meanings.definition: A former gold coin of Florence, Italy.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in Florence used florins to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: The florins from Florence were known for their beautiful design.
meanings.sent3: Why did the florin go to the art museum? To see its own face on the coins!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as precious as a florin, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The florins jingled in his pocket, a sound of wealth and history.

meanings.definition: A former silver coin of the Netherlands.
meanings.sent1: Long ago, the Dutch used florins made of silver for trade.
meanings.sent2: The florins minted in the Netherlands were highly sought after.
meanings.sent3: Why did the florin wear a tiny crown? It wanted to be the king of coins!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like a silver florin, pure and bright.
meanings.sent5: The florins gleamed in the sunlight, a reflection of prosperity.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in some countries.
meanings.sent1: Tourists exchanged their dollars for local florins to shop.
meanings.sent2: The value of florins can fluctuate based on the economy.
meanings.sent3: Why did the florin refuse to be spent? It wanted to stay in the wallet and relax!
meanings.sent4: His words were like valuable florins, carrying weight in every conversation.
meanings.sent5: The florins passed from hand to hand, connecting people through trade.
